edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.classproject.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Map class represents the game's map and all the Entity objects contained within.
    Author:
    Aidan Novobilski
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean debug
      This field represents whether or not the game is in "debug mode".
      private Entity[][] gameMap
      This field represents the game's map, and the locations of every entity within the game world.
      private java.util.Random rand
      This field represents the random number generator used in determining random outcomes.
      private static long serialVersionUID
      This field represents the unique ID used for saving and loading via serialization.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(boolean debug)
        Initializes and places all Entity objects necessary within the game map. (0, 0 is the top left corner, and so on.) First it will
        Parameters:
        debug - true if in debug mode, false otherwise.

      • placeRooms

        private void placeRooms()
        This method will generate the nine rooms and randomly add the briefcase to one of them. It will then add the rooms into the map. If #debug is true, the room with the briefcase will be visible.

      • placeEnemies

        private void placeEnemies()
        This method will generate the six Enemy, and place them within the game world. If debug is true, then the enemies will be visible

      • placeItems

        private void placeItems()

      • placeRandomly

        public void placeRandomly(Entity entity)
        This method will generate a random position, and if it is unoccupied, it will place the given entity in that position.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to place

      • getDebug

        public boolean getDebug()
        This method will return whether the game is in debug mode. Useful for loading a save.
        Returns:
        true if game is in debug mode, false otherwise
